page.title: 04Springholm Primary School
page.content: Springholm's new primary school was opened on the 20th October 1969,and Mr Bailey,the Director of Education,was present for its opening. There were five teachers and a Headmaster,and a role of 120 children. Among the pupils attending were from Kirkpatrick Durham,Crocketford,and of course Springholm. Today Springholm has a total of around 80 children. It has four teachers including Mr Doherty who teaches P6/7 and is also the Head. One of the new subjects which has been introduced is Computer Studies. They have 2 computers and they give the children keyboard experience which will help in Secondary School. At the moment the primary has no Extra Curricular Activities because the EIS, the main teaching union, have asked all teachers to withdraw their goodwill since August 1984.
